A C D E F G H I M O R S T U W X 

A

AbstractChar - Class in entities.characters
The AbstractChar class does most of the behind-the-scenes work for the Character portion of the combat system, including inventory management and combat actions.
AbstractChar() - Constructor for class entities.characters.AbstractChar
 
AbstractConsumable - Class in items.consumables
This class handles the getters and setters for the Consumable family of classes, as well as the .equals() and .toString() methods.
AbstractConsumable() - Constructor for class items.consumables.AbstractConsumable
 
AbstractTimedConsumable - Class in items.consumables
This class differentiates itself from the regular AbstractConsumable by also containing a .remove() method, which removes the bonus from the target Character.
AbstractTimedConsumable() - Constructor for class items.consumables.AbstractTimedConsumable
 
AbstractWeapon - Class in items.weapons
The class that handles all of the getters and setters for the Weapon type, as well as the .equals() and .toString() methods.
AbstractWeapon() - Constructor for class items.weapons.AbstractWeapon
 
act(ArrayList<Entity>) - Method in class entities.characters.AbstractChar
The AbstractChar .act() method runs through each duration in the durations ArrayList and lowers the value by 1, removes any effects if necessary, prints out a status line, then asks the player for input.
act(ArrayList<Entity>) - Method in class entities.Entity
The .act() method is how an Entity interacts with the combat system.
act(ArrayList<Entity>) - Method in class entities.monsters.Monster
For Monsters, the act method simply finds the instance of Char in the encounter ArrayList and attacks it.
addBonus(AbstractTimedConsumable) - Method in class entities.characters.AbstractChar
This method adds a timed consumable to the character's ArrayList of bonuses, then runs the .addDuration() method on the same consumable.
addXP(int) - Method in class entities.characters.AbstractChar
Adds an amount of XP equal to the amount inputted to the AbstractChar's XPtotal.
apply(AbstractChar) - Method in class items.consumables.AbstractTimedConsumable
This method, in addition to modifying the stats of a character, also adds the item to the list of durations in the Character's class.
apply(AbstractChar) - Method in interface items.consumables.Consumable
This method applies the bonus of the item to a given target Character, modifying any stats as necessary.
apply(AbstractChar) - Method in class items.consumables.DefensePotion
The DefensePotion's .apply() method sets the defense of the target character to their defense plus the mod stat of the DefensePotion, and runs the targets .addBonus() method to add the DefensePotion and its duration to their respective lists in the target.
apply(AbstractChar) - Method in class items.consumables.HealthPotion
This method checks what the difference between the target's current HP and max HP is, and depending on the size of the difference does not apply (current HP is max), heals the target to full (difference between current and max HP is less than or equal to the mod stat), or heals the target for mod HP.
attack(Entity) - Method in class entities.characters.AbstractChar
"Attacks" the target Entity by calculating a damage value and then making the target's current HP equal to their previous current HP minus that damage value.
attack(Entity) - Method in class entities.Entity
This method makes the entity attack another Entity, which is the default option for monsters/NPCs.
attack(Entity) - Method in class entities.monsters.Monster
 
attackString(int, Entity) - Method in class entities.monsters.Goblin
 
attackString(int, Entity) - Method in class entities.monsters.Monster
The .attackString() method constructs a String that lets the player know what happened in a stylized manner that is meant to vary by monster.
attackString(int, Entity) - Method in class entities.monsters.Orc
 
attackString(int, Entity, Entity) - Method in class items.weapons.Dagger
 
attackString(int, Entity, Entity) - Method in class items.weapons.Fist
 
attackString(int, Entity, Entity) - Method in class items.weapons.ShortSword
 
attackString(int, Entity, Entity) - Method in interface items.weapons.Weapon
This method returns a String containing stylized information on how much the weapon is doing, representing the attack using the weapon.
